dublin_core.dcvalue: The Telecare Medical Information System TMIS provides a set of different medical services to the patient and medical practitioner The patients and medical practitioners can easily connect to the services remotely from their own premises There are several studies carried out to enhance and authenticate smartcard based remote user authentication protocols for TMIS system In this article we propose a set of enhanced and authentic Three Factor 3FA remote user authentication protocols utilizing a smartphone capability over a dynamic Cloud Computing CC environment A user can access the TMIS services presented in the form of CC services using his smart device e g smartphone Our framework transforms a smartphone to act as a unique and only identity required to access the TMIS system remotely Methods Protocols and Authentication techniques are proposed followed by security analysis and a performance analysis with the two recent authentication protocols proposed for the healthcare TMIS system
Made available in DSpace on 2020-02-10T17:50:16Z (GMT). No. of bitstreams: 0 Previous issue date: 2013-12-18
Smart environment as a service: three factor cloud based user authentication for telecare medical information system.
